summary: This is an email chain between legal counsel regarding missing testifying witness materials in the US v. Maxwell case. Laura Menninger requests confirmation about missing document 3521-003, and a follow-up email provides the corrected, stamped materials.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: She is a partner at Haddon, Morgan & Foreman, P.C., and is corresponding with the prosecution about missing witness materials in the US v. Maxwell case.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: He is copied on the email correspondence regarding the missing testifying witness materials in the US v. Maxwell case.

connections.description: Both are legal professionals involved in the US v. Maxwell case, copied on correspondence about missing witness materials.

events.title: Request for Missing Witness Materials
events.description: Laura Menninger emails the prosecution to inquire about missing testifying witness materials (document 3521-003) in the US v. Maxwell case.

events.title: Provision of Corrected Materials
events.description: A follow-up email is sent providing the corrected, stamped materials for document 3521-003, which had been inadvertently skipped.

keyFacts: The document is email correspondence regarding the US v. Maxwell criminal case.
Defense attorney Laura Menninger identifies missing testifying witness materials (document 3521-003).
The prosecution acknowledges an inadvertent error in stamping and provides corrected materials.
The correspondence highlights procedural aspects of evidence sharing between prosecution and defense.
